==== Concilio ====
Revisar Carretazo del Concilio aplicable para el 2012

Este año el concilio ha promovido y liderado las actividades de la comunidad, siempre tratando de innovar y apoyar las iniciativas de la comunidad así como a las comunidades hermanas!

Participación y logística de eventos como el aniversario del team, la gestación y desarrollo de los proyectos, la participación de la comunidad en eventos internacionales además de muchos planes a realizar es la mejor muestra que la creación y consolidación del concilio es uno de los mejores pasos que ha dado nuestra comunidad.

Toda la información del Concilio:
https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-co-concilio

==== Proyectos ====
Actividades de los proyectos

===== Soporte =====
REVISAR CARRETAZO!
El crecimiento de la comunidad nos ha puesto a buscar nuevas formas de soporte! en esto el proyecto de soporte ha sido vanguardista! primero usando nuestra lista de correos y la plataforma de Q&A de Launchpad.. hasta opciones mas recientes que se han venido consolidando como lo es <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu.shapado.com/|Shapado]]</nowiki> y el manejo innovador que le hemos dado a las redes sociales.

Ideas que sin la colaboración de compañeros como Jorge Cuadrado O Jhosman Lizarazo no se habrían podido concretar!

Sitio oficial de ubuntu shapado:
http://ubuntu.shapado.com/

Adicionalmente nuestra plataforma de soporte ahora es mucho mas amplia gracias a la implementación de las redes sociales como Twitter, Facebook y Google Plus.

===== Sitio Web =====
Se rediseño la pagina de la comunidad, para lograr una mayor integración con las redes sociales, también facilitar la navegabilidad y su visibilidad óptima en cualquier navegador. Se adicionaron zonas especiales para los visitantes y usuarios con respecto a la comunidad, redes sociales, documentación descarga y ayudas sobre Ubuntu.

Sitio en Launchpad:
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-co-sitioweb

Se consiguió la validación como una página certificada de Google Plus dicha red social:
https://plus.google.com/100644953749053145796/posts

===== Documentacion =====
REVISAR DOCUMENTACION Y OTROS
Se creo este proyecto con el fin de mantener al día la documentación y reportes que se generan en la comunidad, los cuales pueden usarse a futuro como medio para medir el crecimiento de la comunidad.

Sitio en Launchpad:
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu-co-documentacion

===== Campus Party =====
Participamos con dos charlas, a cargo de los compañeros <nowiki>[[JuliánAlarcón|Julián Alarcón]]</nowiki> y SergioMeneses, como ayudar a ubuntu y formar comunidades alrededor de una distribución de GNU/Linux.

También el compañero SergioMeneses elaboro un post de la participación en su blog: <nowiki>[[http://sergioandresmeneses.wordpress.com/2011/07/12/ubuntu-colombia-en-la-campusparty-2011/|Enlace]]</nowiki>

{{https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-kCfjE_-BvnM/ThXuLaaOsnI/AAAAAAAAHDI/cToJbc47Egg/s640/IMG_0127.JPG}}

===== Ubuntu Release Party 11.10 =====
Nos reunimos en la casa del compañero JorgeGonzalez para festejar el lanzamiento de la nueva versiónde Ubuntu y charlar sobre temas de la comunidad. Fue un excelente momento para reunirnos y compartir en comunidad :D

{{https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-Ui0ce2OAWvM/TqBQ380SZLI/AAAAAAAAHUo/IWaaybuo1Fo/s640/100_3201.JPG}}

== REPORT FOR 2010 ==

== Actual Status ==

Ubuntu Colombia is growing faster, and Ubuntu in Colombia is expanding their influence everyday. Now, we are a great community with big goals and wishes.

On this years Ubuntu Colombia and his directives had been changing to respond to the different challenges that we confront. Many people has been integrated to our works and helping us to keep working for and with Ubuntu.

We want to broadcast the Ubuntu Philosophy and Ubuntu Operative System across our country, we have many obstacles but the people around Ubuntu Colombia is a memorable group of activist and passionated for Ubuntu and Free Software.

This are some of our big changes and projects in the last 2 years:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;  font-size: 0.9em; width:30%; background:#F1F1DD; margin: 0 0 1em 1em;" style="padding:0.5em;"> '''Contents'''
|-
| 
|}
=== Ubuntu Colombia Council ===

Ubuntu Colombia now is managed by the Ubuntu Colombia Council. The election of the members of the Council is by merits and democracy. Ubuntu Colombia's Council is conformed by 7 people (https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-co-concilio), one of them is the actual Contact for Ubuntu Colombia.

Some of their responsibilities are:

 {*} Promote and support the activities that become to a bigger spread of Ubuntu and Software Libre in Colombia.

 {*} Guarantee the community unity.

 {*} Coordinate and monitor the activities of every project of Ubuntu Colombia and their creation.

 {*} Define the way of make decisions in the process inside Ubuntu Colombia.

 {*} To serve of guide for persons who wants to collaborate in the development of Ubutu.

This council tries to held a meeting every 15 days to discuss subjects about the Team in the public channel of IRC #ubuntu-co-meeting . And the logs/reports of the meetings are saved <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Concilio/Reuniones|here]]</nowiki>

More info about the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Concilio|council]]</nowiki>.

=== Projects ===

The projects are a great tool to be in touch to the people to show them the way of work and collaboration that is under Ubuntu. Every project have a Project leader who take the decision of the project.

This are some of the actual groups working in Ubuntu Colombia:

 {*} <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Proyectos/SitioWeb|Proyecto del Sitio Web]]</nowiki>
 {*} <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Proyectos/Soporte|Proyecto de Soporte]]</nowiki>
 {*} <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Proyectos/Jugadores|Proyecto de Jugadores]]</nowiki>
 {*} <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Proyectos/Imagen|Proyecto de Imagen]]</nowiki>

More info about <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/Proyectos|our projects]]</nowiki>
Launchpad site: https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-co-proyectos/

=== Participation on Ubuntu official media and co-work with regional LoCo teams ===

Ubuntu Colombia has been always a community focused on events, projects and collaboration. But one of our big goals was to collaborate with other LoCo Teams and regional/global events and show this on the official Ubuntu channels besides the work inside of our country.

Our participation with another Teams is growing and now we are one of the most collaborative Teams in different global/regional events (GBJ, UGJ, Ubuntu User Day, Ubuntu Open Week)

And, additional to this, we are using now the official channels to spread or work to world, on Planet Ubuntu (thanks to <nowiki>[[HollmanEnciso|Hollman Enciso]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[ingforigua|Diego Forigua]]</nowiki> ) and in the Ubuntu LoCo Teams Monthly Reports (https://wiki.ubuntu.com/ColombianTeam/TeamReports/).

=== Mailing list archive ===

Two years ago we had 281 members in our <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-co|mailiing list]]</nowiki>, now we have 939 members!!! 

According to the <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-co/|mailing list archive]]</nowiki>, this is the amount in size of the list.
Note: The mailing list of Ubuntu Colombia doesn't accept emails in html format or files.

<nowiki>[[File:ubuntuco-mailarchive.png]]</nowiki>

We can see 2 special behaviors:
1. The mailing list in the months of October, November an December of 2008 was very active, that, probably was because of the organization of the UbuCon Colombia 2008, one event held only by Ubuntu Colombia, with many responsibilities and coordination.

1. The size of the mailing list is decreasing in the last months, this maybe could be explain by the moderation to every message on the list. Almost every message is approved or declined by the 4 moderators of the mailing list.

=== Website visitors ===

Our website is wearing a new design after 2 years of use the old Ubuntu theme. Our website is the main point of contact with the community and users in general.

Now, we have 1.992 members registered in our website. Normally, we have 70 visits per day, the majority from Colombia.

<nowiki>[[File:ubuntuco-website.png]]</nowiki>

== New plans, goals and milestones ==

 {*} Keep working with the projects and organize a better system relationship with the leaders.

 {*} Increase the work with another communities, and keep the co-work on commons projects of the region, like the Documentation in Spanish or the Ubuntu-Es forums.

 {*} Increase the Ubuntu Colombia membership numbers to 200 in the next 2 years.

 {*} Held another UbuCon centered on Ubuntu new projects and commercial market.

 {*} Participate in more events, and help in the organization.

 {*} Spread Ubuntu and our philosophy in Colombia.
